Groups.Group: Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 6
Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 7

Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk devtoolset-4
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: devtoolset-4 bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated devtoolset-4 packages that fix several bugs and add various enhancements are now available for Red Hat Developer Toolset 4.1. Red Hat Developer Toolset is a Red Hat offering for developers on the Red Hat Enterprise Linux platform that provides current versions of the GNU Compiler Collection (GCC), GNU Debugger (GDB), Eclipse development platform, and other development, debugging, and performance monitoring tools. The devtoolset-4 package is the main meta package of the devtoolset-4 Software Collection and installs other Red Hat Developer Toolset 4.1 packages as dependencies.
The devtoolset-4 packages have been upgraded to version 4.1, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1276365, BZ#1301003, BZ#1319297)
For detailed changes in this release, see the Red Hat Developer Toolset 4.1 User Guide linked from the References section.
Users of devtoolset-4 are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
